name: Run With The Best
description: My attempt at a Connection deck. Economy is vital to get out early, hence Andromeda (plus her flavor text lends itself well to the name of the deck). There's plenty of resource-protection to help preserve the Connections. Donut is a natural fit in a deck with only 6 Events, significantly slowing down some decks without hurting me at all. Logos is there for the increased handsize, and to help counter fast-advance decks by getting exactly what I need when I need it. If I can cut enough influence out of the deck, I might move it to an Ian Sterling deck instead, but I'm happy with it as Andromeda for now.

name: Pure Neutral
description: There's enough neutral cards to make a neutral-only Corp deck! It's probably pretty awful but it's something, right?

name: The Kraken Express
description: Omega, Knight and Inside Job can deal with almost any server three ice deep. There's only one Omega for influence reasons but you can tutor it with Special Order. Extra ice can be dealt with using Recon to make them flip it up, then Emergency Shutdown to flip it back down. Or Kraken it (take your Knights off that server first), or use Crypsis. Deja Vu can get back a program if it is destroyed or else act as a fourth Same Old Thing. This deck is 48 cards but there's nothing to cut.

name: Pure Neutral: Runner Edition
description: Inspired by LSK's Pure Neutral Corp deck, but not as playable mainly due to lack of good icebreakers. There's a bunch of extra memory here to make Overminds last a bit longer, and Public Sympathy lets you spend more time drawing cards to find them, while The Source slows the Corp down a bit.

name: where run
Goodteki
Goodteki
Goodteki
Silhouette Deck - Run!!!
description: Attack central servers to score agendas, mainly HQ. Fast paced. Little rough around the edges, only first build. Hopefully streamlining it before a regional tournament.

name: Chaos kills herself
description: The aim is to cast Stimhack (or Planned Assault) as your last card, killing yourself with the brain damage. To do this on your first turn you need a card that lets you play or discard extra cards without using clicks (Modded, Capstone, Freelance, Savoir) or play click-neutral cards like All-nighter and Early bird. If you get two stimhack effects in your opening hand you sometimes have to cast one and hope it doesn't make you discard the other, but usually this deck works pretty "well".

name: Iain Sterling - Criminal Network v1
description:
The impetus of this deck was the desire to find a play style that was different from the usual Criminal style--hard-charging from the get-go, but losing steam in the late-game. Iain's style seems to be slow-but-steady-wins-the-race.

A combination of Iain's core ability and multiple resources form the bulk of this deck's economy. Rabbit Holes and Borrowed Satellites ensure that Underworld Contacts (a.k.a "dirty money") are providing credits early while also enabling a larger hand size. Only five of 40 cards costs more than three credits (18 only cost zero or one!), so a drip economy should be more effective.

Because of the large number of resources, tag defense is critical. The high link provided by the Holes and Satellites is coupled with Decoys, New Angeles City Hall, and Compromised Employees. Should the Corp manage to land tags, Crash Space and Fall Guy are there to help mitigate the damage and provide econ in the form of free tag removal.

Burst economy is provided by Calling In Favors. With 17 connection resources in the deck, even if you only have half of them installed, CIF should provide significant credits for late-game runs and keep the runner from stalling. Emergency Shutdown provides a counter to expensive ICE that might otherwise slow you down.

This deck is also different from most Criminal decks in that it is light on Events. Donut Taganes is included to capitalize on that by providing a small, but steady drain on the Corp's burst economy. He can be trashed in the late-game when you're setup and ready to unleash CIF.

Get your network of connections in place as quickly as possible. Use Hostage to get Professional Contacts, Kati Jones, and Donut into play early. With only one copy of each Criminal breaker, you'll need to be mindful where/when you run. Cripsis provides a backup in case you need to run a remote or you lose a primary breaker.

Remember: slow, but steady -- like drinking a glass of scotch. Savor the experience.

name: Tenma's "A Game of Clones" Blackguard Deck
description:
First deck published, so any feedback would be great!

The idea behind the deck was to take advantage of the 17 influence and splash in some solid out-of-faction breakers for remotes, multi card access, and event recursion/power shutdown counter with an AR Levy and Sacrificial Constructs. The rest of the faction breakers will be there to help pressure centrals and potentially set up an RnD lock. With 9 run events, I will still be able to get some use out of his ID ability.

I dropped x3 copies of a few cards to make room for x3 Quality Time and help draw through the deck faster. If I end up discarding a few things here and there, I still have my AR Levy.

The economy is still a work in progress. The few test games I have played, gaining credits has been hit or miss. Is it just bad luck, or is there a better way to get my economy going more consistently?

name: Unstealable
description:
Terrible name, 'Thief Proof' would have been better but I wanted to keep it related to db0's Untrashable where this version is derived from: http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/3489/untrashable-v5 . The idea behind this deck is the same as it his in his deck. Make multiple runs against this deck's centrals or a single run on a remote as expensive/painful as possible. The runner will spend most of his turns drawing cards and trying to get his economy back up which gives you a scoring window. If not, this deck can kill a careless runner. I won't go into too much detail since db0 does a much better job explaining the concept. I'll just explain my changes to his version:

Agendas: I changed the Agenda Suite to one that taxes the runner even more. I lose the incredible strength of Nisei MK2 and the deck becomes a little bit slower because of it but having three of both NAPD Contract and Fetal AI coupled with The Future Perfect means that a poor Runner cannot take Agendas from you. Multi-access strategies via Maker's Eye, RDI etc become not only hilariously expensive but dangerous as well since a Snare into Fetal or Shock can easily be deadly depending on the ICE protecting RnD. The only Agenda that remains accessible the usual way is Philotic Entanglement. Before H&P, this used to be Braintrust, just to fill it up to 20 points. I never got the ability going (which with a whole 12 ICE ain't too good anyway). Philotic is filling the same spot being the one Agenda rounding the count out to 20 but it has more uses. Your opponent will notice quickly that you play rather expensive agendas and stops running your unrezzed and un-advanced remotes after a couple turns or if you got a suitable amount of unrezzed remotes already (like Protocols, Jacksons, Snares mebbe etc) so you can easily sneak a cheeky Philotic out. Your opponent might get ahead on the Agenda count and score a few before you get going resulting in you sniping a couple cards from their hand. You spent your turn advancing, they spend their turn drawing up again, effectively wasting their turn and you got 2 points for it. Fair deal.

Assets: The only change I made here is Mental Health Clinic over PAD Campaign which is something I'm testing at the moment and so far it has been amazing. On paper, it looks rather terrible. Giving your opponent more cards to hold in a deck that deals net damage? In practice, it works a lot better since your opponent still has to draw his cards and spend clicks on that. The real advantage lies in its rez cost. Not having to play 2 to rez is just amazing. Usually, you're faced with quite a dilemma in the early game: Rezzing ICE or activating a Snare and then not having enough money to rez your PAD campaign resulting in you wasting a turn trying to get some credits to rez the Campaign later, again throwing you back in the credit department. With the clinic, that is gone. You gain a 2 click advantage right off the start and can plan much more precisely what cards you want to play. It does mean, however, that Ronin becomes worse. I had already taken him out before H&P but now, there is a more intriguing option:

Operations: A singleton copy of Diversified portfolio may seem odd (it rather is, actually, I just wanted to test it) but it's a card you want in the mid to late game and you don't want to draw too many, so one is actually quite okay. In this deck, you can easily make 6-8 credits with it and use it as great monetary recovery after a big assault where you rezzed a lot of cards. Who needs Restructure when you got 8 remotes (and some of those make money too!).

ICE: Komainu for 1 Tsurugi because they do similar things, with Komainu being less flexible but he is way more taxing and works well with the Clinics and even better with his BFF Hokusai Grid. Enigma over Data Pike because clicks are hard to come by facing this deck. The Deck is still in a testing phase but a blast to play with if you like micromanagement in Netrunner. ...And somehow I spent more time explaining a couple changes than the original deck's creator spent explaining the entire deck. Oh well, I hope, if you made it this far, you at least enjoyed it a bit.

name: Slow Leaks - Patient DLR
description:
The exact opposite of the usual DLR Anarch deck. Spend the early game grabbing a few agendas to pawn, and building up your board. Once you feel you can support it, start taking tags and milling, while they're struggling to score through Chakana.

-NACH + Stirling + Joshua B. will give you 5 clicks a turn instead of your 2 credits, if you feel you need it. (Not sure if that combo needs to be there, I just want to try it.)

-Unregistered actually helps with DLR's main weakness: Jackson Howard. If you can't wait to mill them, it should enable glory runs.

name: Reins Hostages, Tops 8 in sydney regional, 26 players-no H&P
description:
I took this deck to our regional today (4/5/14), it went 4-1(swiss), and paired along side a NBN Mid seasons deck 3-2 (swiss).

its a hard deck IMO to play, you have to play to what you draw, even clicking for credits, hemorrhage was gold every time i got it.

name: Jinteki Fast Advance
Wizzard's Spells FAST "wyldside"
description: Change with the new cards from the next set?

name: Iain's Connections 3.0
description: So... I now have my own twist of an Iain deck, and this basically runs only on Centrals. In mid game I should have Tri-mafs and/or May's Motivation (made up name for Motivation + Oracle May) for econ, that's why I have Mr. Li, Logos, and Hostage for tutoring, then late game go for big Vamp run to access next to remotes, leaving the Corp crawling for creds.

name: Jinkteki Wall
Toy boy - run often, run poor
description:
A standard Ken list.

The classic anarch breaker suite + datasucker + faerie + special order (with femme as a "joker") allows you to start running early and efficiently. The only downside is that deep servers with high strength ice might shut you out in the late game if you can't leverage the datasuckers so make sure to put the pressure on early.

The econ is quite light with siphons as the main source of money in the early to mid game. They can be tutored and recurred with same old to keep going. You generally want to play tag-me as you have no valuable resources, hence the 3 plascrete.

Planned assault + indexing and legwork allows you to put a lot of pressure on both HQ and R&D, and once they've been tutored they can be recurred with same old.

Infiltration is there because I expect jinteki to become more popular, and it's also decent vs never advance strategies.

The 1 LARLA is to make sure you don't run out of econ (since there's no persistent source of credits) if the game drags on or you're playing vs jinteki.

Cards I'm considering : stimhack and vamp as 1-of tutor targets, knight, more quality time.

name: next design deck
Jinteki match Point Rush!
Exposed in 3 Seconds
description: Be free to comment my Early Beta Build for my very first Silhoutte Runner Deck

name: Jet set Andro
description:
An experiment with connections.

This deck is more controlish than most criminal builds.Your focus should be on setting up your connection economy composed of compromised employee, tri-maf and Kati, with calling in favors for a big burst later on. The first connection you usually want to tutor up with hostage is Mr.Li, which helps you find the rest of the cards. Hostage also helps you to find your silver bullets when needed : decoy vs scorched earth decks (CI and Supermodernism) as SEA source is often the bottleneck of their combo, scrubber vs asset-based econs (Jinteki RP and NBN), the source vs fast advance (CI mostly, but also HB and NBN). Fall guy should be used in priority to protect tri-maf and a loaded kati, or to re-use decoy and the source in match-ups where they are key.

The 1-of e3 and RDI might seem out of place but they can be key to have in the late game and you cycle through a lot of cards with Mr.Li so you have a decent chance of finding them.

The only thing I'm not too happy with at the moment is the breaker suite which favours early aggression but gets weaker vs bigger ice. I'd love to play bigger, more expensive ice breakers (the deck has the econ to support it) but I just can't find the influence and I don't want to drop to a single copy of each breaker with no way to recur them.

Cards I'm considering :

  • Gordian blade : see above. I might try -1 mimic -1 yog -1 datasucker for +1 faerie +1 femme +1 gordian blade.

  • Sure gamble : I don't think the deck needs more econ so it would probably replace either dirty laundry or calling in favours. Needs more testing.

  • Donut : can be very powerful against the right decks, but the influence is tight and the deck plays quite a few events itself.

  • Inside job : gives more flexibility early game. Again the room is difficult to find, I think it's a meta call between this (better vs rush decks) and emergency shutdown (better vs taxing decks). Also emergency shutdown is nice with compromised employee.

name: Thin Black Line v.3
description:
Revise, rinse, repeat.

Fast, fun. Thoughts?

name: NBN Meth V6
Replicating love
description:
An unusual approach of Jinteki RP, replacing the flatline potential by more taxing and a never advance agenda strategy.

The ice count is a bit higher than a typical RP deck because without the protection of snare, shock and fetal AI you want to be able to ice up your central early, and maintain the protection vs parasite recursion decks.

Once you've iced up the centrals you want to create a small tower and score your agendas aggressively, using the tried-and-tested never advance approach which puts the runner in an awkward spot of having to potentially run an empty server.

Diversified portfolio was tried and rejected because it doesn't help you get started early on and only get better than hedge fund once you have 6 remotes - by then your econ should be set up.

name: Hemo Noise V6
Lucky Gab V2
Building a Better Mouse Trap v1.1
Kit's Paintbrush v1.2
description: Now, Let's go paint some happy trees...

name: Meeting up in your servers
description:
This is actually my first A:NR deck. I chose Andy for the 9 cards, to get what I need at the start of the game and build from there. The idea is to start running aggressively from the beginning, using your special orders to find the icebreakers you need.

The connections package is for card drawing (Mr. Li), economy (Katie Jones, Underworld Contacts) and Decoy is there for when you face a Sea Source combo or Tag+Scorch on the same turn.

Dysons are for activating Underworld Contacts, plus the extra MU is useful for you Sneakdoor. Indexing is to put pressure on R&D and Same old Thing is to recur those events you really need again, like Indexing, Account Siphon or anything else you need again.

I'm happy to receive any suggestions you can make, as this is a WIP and I think can be improved a lot.

name: Reservations Please
description:
Sir you need to spend money to steal that agenda. What all your money is tied up at the moment due to an RSVP? Guess you'll have to jack out. No trashing assets for you either. Caprice Nisei can always end the run if the runner can't spend money.

Getting back 3 Celebrity Gifts with Reclamation Order is amazing.

Going with Red Herrings instead of Ash as in db0's Untrashable due to being cheaper and does not prevent the access of the Fetal AI.

Corporate Troubleshooter is a new addition that I have not tested yet. The influence was used for an Aggressive Secretary however have not been able to get it to connect. Removed Snares as well to have zero assets with a zero trash cost.

Himitsu-Bako laughs at Parasites.

Philotic Entanglement could be another The Future Perfect however it's present increases the likely hood of the runner needing 4 agendas and can be installed unadvanced to pretend it is another upgrade.

name: Ty-Reina-saurus Wrecks v1.1
description:
Two breakers @ +5, other breaker supported by Datasucker/Parasite. HQ pressure from Nerve Agent/Vamp, R&D from Medium.

v1.1: CMade changed per this thread on /r/netrunner
http://www.reddit.com/r/Netrunner/comments/24fvog/decktyreinasauruswreckstipsand_thoughts/

name: Jingerly v1
description:
Jingeryy is playing to the theme that the Runner must step lightly, while at the same time, puts the pressure on though the threat of Mushi and Agenda scoring. Make a wrong choice and you're flat-lined.

Not thoroughly tested, and very much looking for feed back on how to make the most deadly and punishing Jinteki deck that pressures Runners into making lethally bad decisions.

Tread gingerly or face quick instant death.

Combos include:

Chum + Komainu

Inazuma + Gyri or Tsurugi or Komaniu

RVSP + Shinobi

Whirpool to top off any of these and a healthy dose of Punitive Counterstrike, Neural EMP and Ronin to just deal damage to passive Runners with Hiro to make sure they're within kill range.

name: Notorious Shadow
description:
This is a deck concept for Silhouette. The plan is to use her ability to make runs on remotes only when you need to (steal agendas or trash really important assets), and the rest of the time you just slam the centrals.

The economy is all in the resources, so you can't float tags, in fact, you need to get every tag removed or the corp will just trash your game. Mr. Li is there to find the cards you need and Same old Thing is to reuse your events, which you'll need to clear the way for your runs (or win via Indexing).

Notoriety is there to get you the last points to win (you can surprise the corp by scoring two points out of nowhere). I went for Inside Job instead of Feint just for the ability to access cards at the end of the run.

The icebreakers let you run on remotes pretty easily (except for code gates). I chose Corroder because it's the best there is, and I had the influence, and the others are centrals only. If you need to run remotes for an agenda, Crypsis is your guy, or Knight if you know it's a high powered ICE. If there's only one, just inside job to get it. I think it can be good, but I'm open to suggestions to improve it.

name: Slow the Advance
description: Main idea is to use Chakana (possibly multiple) and The Source to make agendas excessively hard to score whilst getting together a decent rig powered by opus economy.

name: Taxman Cometh I (Pre-H&P)
description: Make runs as expensive as possible. Asset based economy (mostly) that's expensive to trash. Caprice to ruin their day.

name: Syphonette
the silhouette connection
description:
crazy idea of deck

run only on central, look remotes with silhouette ability if its an agenda do a quest completed, if nothing else, do notoriety

get money from calling in favors

name: PadBar Warszawa 29.04.2014
PadBar Warszawa 29.04.2014
Next Design more like Speed Design
description:
Next is a rush deck, the ideal starting is 3 early game end the run's and hedge fund to start off at 10 credits and 3 ice. The idea is to build a fast early remote server to push through a few early agendas. Then play some advance tricks build money off of Haas or the GRNDL refinery.

Fast Track is a beast in this deck, once you have a early scoring server to push out 2 agendas fast track and biotic's can get you the win.

name: Make a run...on the double
description: Run events to make good use of ID. Feint/inside job to make those 3 central server runs successful to score Notoriety. Then forfeit Notoriety via frame job and blackmail your way into remotes- much to the corp's surprise. Did OK in brief play testing today but struggled sometimes with economy and got scorched one game leading me to think that maybe plascrete would be a good addition. I feel the deck idea is good though, but would appreciate some feedback for any changes, and especially cards I could cut to make the deck 45...

name: The Tortoise
description: (As in, the hare and the tortoise) Plan is simple. Let the corp get ahead while you set up all the economy drip you need. Scarce events because you want to get Donut out and let the corp suffer his punishment. Hostage will let you find whichever resource you need there and then. Logos console to find whichever breaker you need/are lacking. Mem chip will not only provide you the link for underworld contacts, but also the memory for your super rig. Performed well in testing today, but that was before I noticed Donut had an influence cost, so had to cut him to one copy and then added Hostages. Calling in favors works wonders when you've all your resources out on the table. Not sure how well this would do against fast advance however, so I added one copy of the source in an attempt to slow them down a little. Oh, and a gun to blow that bitch Caprice's head off. Any feedback very welcome...

name: FAD
description:
This is my first published deck. I don't speak english very well but I will try to explain the idea.

FAD means Fast Avance and Damage. The only difference with the other Fast Avance decks is runner's fear. Snare! stops psychologically the runner and Shi.Kyu is only a menace (you pay to win the match but runner chooses -1 point, so this idea helps FA).

It doesn't matter (and we preffer) the runner steals the first Medical Breakthrough.

We have cheap ETR ICES. I think Plan B is one of the best card in Android: Netrunner. Runner can make a run against that and we score an agenda; if runner knows what we have, we can use Trick of light. Ice Wall is a wildcard: we have ETR and advance tokens. I dream with the day I make a chain with unorthodox predictions.

I think the deck explains himself better than me.

name: Fast Jinteki, Shi Kyu
The Wyldside Express v1.2
description: Wyldside gives Tenma all the run events. Never stop running.

name: YOU CAN'T CUT BACK ON CARD FUNDING
description:
YOU WILL REGRET THIS!!!

(just an experiment to see what the maximum number of cards in a deck could be if you include all possible agendas. it's not every card in the game! anyway, time to take this baby to octgn and stomp some nerds)

name: Set Sail!
description:
First attempt.

Slightly slower deck with strong economy and load of silver bullets, plenty of ways to modify rig mid-run.

SET SAIL!

name: Andy Connection Power
description: Motivation and Oracle May seems really abusable, so I tweaked my Andy deck to run the package. I had to sacrifice a Corroder and a Emergency Shutdown for the Motivation's, and a Mimic for Oracle May.

name: I, Bioroid
I. Stirling
description: My take on a connections deck.

name: Indecent Exposure v2
description:
Still a work in progress.

Force the crop to rez stuff when and where they do not want to so that I can get accesses where I want to be.

Shut down their ice to rerez it.

SOT and Levy AR Lab Access to reoccur economy and shutdowns/SOT.
